intro: Salvia japonica f. polakioides, commonly known as Japanese sage or Japanese scarlet sage, is a compact, herbaceous perennial native to Japan. It features striking red-purple flower spikes that bloom in late summer to early autumn, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant has lance-shaped, hairy leaves that are aromatic when crushed, contributing to its medicinal and ornamental value. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its unique color and compact growth habit make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking vibrant, low-maintenance plants.
